intro: Chrysoscias calycina, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Chrysoscias calycina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and low maintenance requirements.
